programme.title: Before I Fall
programme.desc: Sam (Zoey Deutch) seems to have everything a teenage girl could want: popularity, a hot boyfriend, cool status, fun friends, loving family and seeming happiness. But beyond the superficial, Sam's life isn't so charmed. She is one of a clique of high school mean girls who make life hell for those who are different. When Sam is killed in a car accident, she is forced to relive her last day on Earth seven times in order to get things right. She attempts to make sense of what befell her and gain a better understanding of herself and others.(n)

programme.title: Kill Bill: Vol. 2
programme.desc: In this sequel to the Quentin Tarantino cult classic, a murderous bride continues her quest for vengeance against her former boss and lover and those who betrayed her, leading up to the ultimate confrontation with the man who ordered her execution. Stars Uma Thurman.(n)

programme.title: The Fantasticks
programme.desc: Joel Grey and Brad Sullivan are small-town fathers conspiring to bring their children together in a love match by pretending to discourage it in this magical musical costarring Barnard Hughes.(n)

programme.title: Pretty Persuasion
programme.desc: When high school student Kimberly Joyce accuses her English teacher of sexual harassment, she turns her exclusive Beverly Hills private school, and everything else in her wake, upside down. Hell hath no fury like a teenager scorned.(n)

programme.title: Lucky Break
programme.desc: Peter Cattaneo ("The Full Monty") directs this British comedy starring James Nesbitt as Jimmy Hands, a raffish robber assigned to a grim correctional facility. When the prison's governor (Christopher Plummer) is persuaded to stage a production of a misguided musical based on the story of Admiral Nelson and Lady Emma Hamilton, Jimmy and his buddies seize the opportunity to plan a jailbreak. However, complicating matters is a lovely therapist (Olivia Williams), who, cast as Jimmy's costar, steals his heart. Timothy Spall and Lennie James costar.(n)

programme.title: Seven Brides for Seven Brothers
programme.desc: Best Picture-nominated hoedown is set in 1850s Oregon, where a group of brothers kidnap a passel of comely lasses with the intention of marriage, but when the men's farm gets snowed in and they're all trapped together, the ladies' hearts begin to melt. An Oscar winner for Best Musical Score.

programme.title: It Happened at the World's Fair
programme.desc: Elvis Presley vehicle in which he plays a pilot who loses his plane due to gambling debts, so he and his partner head to the 1962 Seattle World's Fair to see if they can get work to earn money to reclaim their impounded aircraft.

programme.title: The Silver Horde
programme.desc: A fisherman in Alaska feuds with the father of the woman he loves, leading to the dad's killing at the hands of the salmon hunter's partner.

programme.title: From Here to Eternity
programme.desc: Best Picture winner is a portrait of life on a Honolulu Army post just before the attack on Pearl Harbor, and focuses on two rebellious privates and a tough but fair-minded sergeant who's swept into a torrid affair with his CO's wife. (cc).

programme.title: The Graduate
programme.desc: A recent college grad in the throes of a nihilistic, existential crisis, begins a tawdry, secret affair with a seductive older woman, but the relationship takes a turn when he realizes his true feelings lay elsewhere. Features an excellent soundtrack of Simon and Garfunkel songs and Oscar-winning direction by Mike Nichols.

programme.title: Double Dynamite
programme.desc: A bank teller's gambling winnings match his bank's cash shortage.

programme.title: High Society
programme.desc: Musical remake of "The Philadelphia Story" (1940) features a score by Cole Porter and stars Grace Kelly as an heiress whose wedding plans are complicated by a reporter (Frank Sinatra) and ex-husband (Bing Crosby). The musical score and the song "True Love" were Oscar nominated. (cc).

programme.title: None But the Brave
programme.desc: Frank Sinatra took over the director's chair for the first (and only) time in this WWII drama, about Japanese and American soldiers stranded on a remote Pacific island. They agree to a truce to focus on bringing help to the island, but once either side's forces reach them, the fighting will pick up where it left off.

programme.title: Robin and the 7 Hoods
programme.desc: Frank Sinatra (who produced) and his Rat Pack (in their final movie collaboration) star in this spoof of gangster films that's set in Roaring '20s Chicago and is a mixture of the Robin Hood fable and "Guys and Dolls." Eight songs by Sammy Cahn and Jimmy Van Heusen highlight the film, including the Oscar-nominated "My Kind of Town" (sung by Sinatra). (cc).

programme.title: Anchors Aweigh
programme.desc: Best Picture nominee is about two sailors, one innocent and inexperienced and the other dashing and cavalier, who go on leave in Hollywood, looking for fun and quite possibly falling in love. One of the musical's highlights is Gene Kelly's dance duet with an animated Jerry the Mouse of "Tom and Jerry" cartoon fame. Features an Oscar-winning score. (cc).

programme.title: It Happened in Brooklyn
programme.desc: An ex-GI meets a titled Englishman who befriends him, and both try to make it big in show business.

programme.title: Take Me Out to the Ball Game
programme.desc: Two vaudevillian song-and-dance men circa 1906, moonlight as semiprofessional baseball players who both fall for the new female owner, while the more naive of the two falls in with a gambling crowd. (cc).

programme.title: The Man With the Golden Arm
programme.desc: An ex-con drug addict must face the demons of his past in order to kick the habit once and for all. Frank Sinatra was nominated for Best Actor as the junkie.

programme.title: Some Came Running
programme.desc: An embittered World War II veteran, whose writing career has stalled, returns to his serene hometown with an easy woman in tow.

programme.title: Suddenly
programme.desc: A gang of killers hold a family hostage in their home while plotting to assassinate the president from their second story window.

programme.title: From Here to Eternity
programme.desc: Best Picture winner is a portrait of life on a Honolulu Army post just before the attack on Pearl Harbor, and focuses on two rebellious privates and a tough but fair-minded sergeant who's swept into a torrid affair with his CO's wife. (cc).

programme.title: Step Lively
programme.desc: Shoestring producers discover a young playwright with a lovely singing voice.

programme.title: Test Pilot
programme.desc: An aviation test pilot relies on the support of his wife and his best friend to help keep him sober and in his right mind, but the stress of putting his life in danger takes its toll.

programme.title: Evelyn Prentice
programme.desc: The neglected wife of a criminal lawyer becomes involved with a vicious gigolo.

programme.title: Libeled Lady
programme.desc: Screwball-comedy classic that was nominated for a Best Picture Oscar chronicles the misadventures of a cutthroat newspaper editor whose scheme to prevent a libel suit ends up exploding in his face as well as all those involved.

programme.title: Man-Proof
programme.desc: About a society girl (Myrna Loy) still pursuing the man who jilted her. Jimmy: Franchot Tone. Elizabeth: Rosalind Russell. Florence: Rita Johnson. Jane: Ruth Hussey. Meg: Nana Bryant. Richard Thorpe directed.

programme.title: Too Hot to Handle
programme.desc: The incredible escapades of a newsreel cameraman (Clark Gable), from New York to the Amazon jungle. Myrna Loy, Walter Pidgeon, Walter Connolly, Leo Carrillo, Johnny Hines, Virginia Weidler, Henry Kolker, Marjorie Main, Al Shean.

programme.title: Third Finger, Left Hand
programme.desc: An artist falls for a man-shy fashion-magazine editor who falsely claims to be married to keep predatory suitors away, and when he discovers her ruse decides to assume the role of the fictitious husband.

programme.title: Wife vs. Secretary
programme.desc: While on a business trip, a devoted, super-efficient secretary answers the phone in her boss's hotel room, prompting his wife to mistakenly believe he is having an affair with her.

programme.title: Mr. Blandings Builds His Dream House
programme.desc: Manhattan marrieds "trade city soot for sylvan charm" when they move to the Connecticut suburbs, where they experience an endless succession of construction nightmares and fiascoes and their new place turns into a money pit.

programme.title: Love Crazy
programme.desc: As they get ready to celebrate their fourth anniversary, a happily married couple find their domestic bliss suddenly on the rocks thanks to a series of misunderstandings that occur after an unexpected visit from the wife's mother.(n)

programme.title: I Love You Again
programme.desc: A stuffy married man who is about to be divorced discovers that he once had amnesia and a previous existence as a con artist, so he sets about re-wooing his wife.(n)

programme.title: Double Wedding
programme.desc: In their seventh screen pairing, Myrna Loy stars as a hard-working successful dress-shop owner who tries to run her sister's affairs equally efficiently, and William Powell plays a bohemian artist who upsets her best-laid plans.(n)

programme.title: The Thin Man
programme.desc: First and best of the famous whodunit series has the wisecracking, martini-sipping husband-and-wife sleuthing team of Nick and Nora Charles investigating the disappearance of an inventor who later is implicated in the murder of his secretary. The film, an adaptation of a Dashiell Hammett private-eye classic, was followed by five sequels. Incidentally, "The Thin Man" refers to the inventor, not Nick Charles. (cc).(n)

programme.desc: Marlene Dietrich at her most glamorous as Concha, collector of hearts. Directed in high style by Josef von Sternberg. Lionel Atwill, Cesar Romero, Edward Everett Horton. Radiantly set at a Spanish carnival.(n)

programme.desc: Swashbuckling saga about a 17th-century Irish doctor who's unjustly charged with treason and sent to Jamaica, where he's sold into slavery, but when pirates attack the island, he and fellow prisoners escape, commandeer a Spanish galleon and set sail on the high seas. This Best Picture nominee made Errol Flynn a star, and is one of nine films he made with director Michael Curtiz.(n)

However, Witt's respite from war is brief as he's captured by the Navy and forced back into combat. (cc).(n)

programme.title: Gladiator
programme.desc: Five Oscars, including Best Picture, went to this epic drama about a Roman general who winds up an enslaved gladiator when he refuses to pledge loyalty to the emperor's power-hungry son. After years in the emperor's army, beloved leader Maximus simply wants to go home to his family. But when the dying ruler's scheming son declares himself Caesar, he orders Maximus executed. The resourceful former general promptly escapes, only to resurface later as an enslaved gladiator with revenge on his mind. (cc).

programme.title: The Wayans Bros.
programme.desc: The family is placed under police protection after Marlon (Marlon Wayans) witnesses a bank robbery. Frank/Jesse: Norris Young. Shawn: Shawn Wayans. Pops: John Witherspoon. Dee: Anna Maria Horsford. Det. Fine: Yareli Arizmendi. (repeat).

programme.title: The Wayans Bros.
programme.desc: Shawn's former boss, Ted (Jack Plotnick), is released from a mental institution and plots revenge against Shawn for causing him to lose his job at an ad agency. Marlon: Marlon Wayans. Pops: John Witherspoon. Dee: Anna Maria Horsford. Mr. Keeler: Robert Starr. (repeat).

programme.title: The Wayans Bros.
programme.desc: Pops (John Witherspoon), Shawn and Marlon compete on the quiz show "Family Battle." Dick Ferndale: Fred Willard. Mr. Webster: Patrick O'Brien. Dee: Anna Maria Horsford. (repeat).

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Franklin's little sister, Aretha (Jamia Simone Nash), is a terrific singer, but he doesn't exactly brag about her. Meanwhile, Jay finds a photo of Michael's former girlfriend among his memorabilia. Why, she wonders, has he saved it? Actually, “wonders” doesn't adequately describe her reaction. “We have a crisis in our marriage,” she fumes. Franklin: Noah Gray-Cabey. (repeat).

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Claire and Tony (Andrew McFarlane) announce that they are going to have sex to Michael and Jay, who react as expected. But after calming down they strategize on how to stop the impending tryst. “We'll scare the pants off them,” Michael tells Jay, “Well, not the pants.” Meanwhile, Jr. gets Kady to think that she made him sick, so she's at his beck and call. But Franklin (Noah Gray-Cabey) smells a rat. (repeat).

programme.title: My Wife and Kids
programme.desc: Claire has been asked to the senior prom, but Michael won't let her go. Their compromise: Michael and Jay will chaperone. Suffice it to say that Jay thinks more of the plan than Claire does (or than Michael does, at first). Meanwhile, Jr's rehabbing an old car and he wants Michael to pay for it. Michael agrees, but that isn't necessarily good news for Jr. Donovan: Roshawn Franklin. (repeat).

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: Jackie stars in a play, but her nerves threaten to get the best of her. OG deals with the death of her brother, the loss ultimately brings her and an enemy close. The Wives come out to support Jackie's play, but there's just as much drama off-stage. (repeat).

programme.title: Basketball Wives
programme.desc: Evelyn's trip to Puerto Rico becomes a more emotional experience than she bargained for. Jen enlists professional help to solve her love life issues. Malaysia has a difficult talk with her son. Jackie helps Reggie plan next step. (repeat).

programme.title: Love & Hip Hop Hollywood: Dirty Little Secrets

programme.title: Black Ink Crew: Chicago
programme.desc: Ryan starts a new shop but faces a learning curve when bringing in a new staff. Lily hires a new artist, which does not fly with Charmaine, who brought Dani back to the shop. Nikki throws Phor a surprise party that shows how much Chi-town loves him. (repeat).

programme.title: Black Ink Crew: Chicago
programme.desc: Charmaine makes a power grab for Loyal Ink, dividing the crew even further. Don faces huge repercussions after getting arrested for a DUI. Dani and Terrence's relationship continues to heat up. (repeat).

programme.desc: Charmaine establishes the "rules" as she continues as H.B.I.C., causing Lily and Reese to rebel. Ryan reveals a long-awaited Mother's Day surprise for Rachel. And Van has a big blow-up with Jenn. (repeat).

programme.title: Polska noc
programme.desc: Dla tych, którzy twierdzą, że w telewizjach muzycznych i radiach pojawia się za mało polskiej muzyki, Eska TV proponuje program "Polska noc". To całonocne pasmo zarezerwowane jest dla krajowych wykonawców.

programme.title: Zranione uczucia
programme.desc: Mała Rita (Mel Maia) w dramatycznych okolicznościach traci ojca. Bezwzględna macocha (Adriana Esteves) i jej przyjaciel porzucają ją na wysypisku śmieci, gdzie musi walczyć o przetrwanie. Tam nawiązuje liczne przyjaźnie i odnajduje miłość swojego życia. Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości.

programme.title: Zranione uczucia
programme.desc: Mała Rita (Mel Maia) w dramatycznych okolicznościach traci ojca. programme.title: Dzień dobry
programme.desc: Poranne pasmo muzyczne, w którym prezentowane są najlepsze teledyski artystów cieszących się dużą popularnością.

programme.title: Eska On The Beach
programme.desc: Wakacyjny program Eski TV nadawany prosto z najpiękniejszych plaż. Ola Kot zaprezentuje widzom wiele ciekawostek, a wśród nich najnowsze plotki, porady modowe oraz wieści muzyczne z kraju i ze świata. Nie zabraknie najnowszych piosenek i teledysków. Widzowie przekonają się, który utwór zasłuży sobie na miano hitu lata.

programme.desc: Mała Rita (Mel Maia) w dramatycznych okolicznościach traci ojca. Bezwzględna macocha (Adriana Esteves) i jej przyjaciel porzucają ją na wysypisku śmieci, gdzie musi walczyć o przetrwanie. Tam nawiązuje liczne przyjaźnie i odnajduje miłość swojego życia. Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości.(n)

programme.title: Projekt Kamper
programme.desc: Filip Rudanacja zamienia swojego garbusa na atrakcyjnego kampera i wyrusza na wakacyjną wyprawę. Prowadzący oddaje się paradzie letnich wyzwań. Wypoczywa, szuka dobrej zabawy przy dźwiękach najlepszej muzyki i robi rzeczy, które każdy powinien wykonać podczas urlopu, jak zjedzenie gofra, czy rozstawienie parawanu.(n)

programme.desc: Mała Rita (Mel Maia) w dramatycznych okolicznościach traci ojca. Bezwzględna macocha (Adriana Esteves) i jej przyjaciel porzucają ją na wysypisku śmieci, gdzie musi walczyć o przetrwanie. Tam nawiązuje liczne przyjaźnie i odnajduje miłość swojego życia. Wkrótce zostaje adoptowana przez małżeństwo z Argentyny. Po wielu latach już dorosła Rita (Débora Falabella), pod imieniem Nina, wraca w rodzinne strony, by zemścić się za krzywdy z przeszłości.(n)

programme.title: The Worst Witch
programme.desc: Mildred's having fun jumping high into the air with Enid - using pirated magic to make the grass bouncy. Maud's getting fed up with Enid constantly distracting Mildred - Maud knows Mildred needs to knuckle down if she's going to stand a chance at the academy and can't bear the thought of losing her. Mildred receives a singing teddy from home and it makes her feel homesick. When Mildred looks to Maud for help in Miss Gullet's transformations class, Maud doesn't bail her out and Mildred turns Ethel into a pig instead of a mouse into frog. She doesn't even manage to turn Ethel back successfully - she still has a pig's snout! Mildred receives a harsh warning from Miss Hardbroom who threatens expulsion if she can't perform the spell correctly. Mildred feels fed up with all the rules of school and always being the worst witch. It's the final straw, she wants to go home. Drusilla intercepts her leaving, telling her that Maud and Enid are fighting. But it's a trick, and Mildred finds herself facing Ethel. As revenge for still having a pig snout, Ethel turns Mildred into a frog and throws her out of the window.

programme.title: The Worst Witch
programme.desc: Everyone's surprised to hear the Great Wizard is making an unexpected visit to Cackle's Academy. He's had a tip off that the school is going rapidly downhill and it looks like non-magical Mildred is at the heart of the problems. Miss Cackle (really Agatha) refuses to expel Mildred and waxes lyrical about her. The Great Wizard insists that Mildred should perform a magical display to prove herself. Creative Mildred conducts a magical potions choir, but it ends in disaster leaving Miss Cackle on thin ice. To everyone's surprise, Miss Cackle (Agatha) makes Mildred lead a broomstick display. Mildred works out that Agatha is impersonating Miss Cackle but has to go ahead with the display - not realising Ethel had put a spell on the broomstick. Mildred begs Maud to find the real Miss Cackle, so while Mildred and Enid are in peril in the air, Maud battles her way up to Miss Cackle's room to find her under an entrancement spell. Just as Mildred and Enid start to plummet, the real Miss Cackle saves them. The Great Wizard has to eat his words - Mildred is a good witch and deserves her place in the school.

programme.title: The Worst Witch
programme.desc: Everyone is excited to learn that the annual Spelling Bee final will be between Cackle's and Pentangle's, with the exceptions of Miss Hardbroom who balks at hearing the rival school will be visiting, and Mildred who will be one of the contestants. Miss Hardbroom is doggedly determined the school will perform brilliantly. Seeing Tabby is a distraction to Mildred (and pretty useless), Tabby is unceremoniously dismissed to the kitchens and Mildred is given a new cat called Ebony. Mildred is distraught, knowing Tabby won't cope as a mouser so Maud and Enid try to help Tabby, but they just make things worse! Miss Pentangle and her contestants arrive, and Miss Hardbroom is on edge. Ethel struggles to know how to act around male contestant, Zac. Mildred learns that Miss Hardbroom and Pentangle were school friends but fell out over a misunderstanding. Against the odds, the Cackle's team win the Spelling Bee. Miss Pentangle sees Mildred's potential and offers her a scholarship at her school. Mildred is flattered but realises she fits in best at Cackle's with her friends. Mildred pushes the two old friends back together so in return, Miss Hardbroom has a rare moment of softness and returns Tabby to Mildred.

programme.title: The Worst Witch

programme.title: The Worst Witch
programme.desc: The end of year exams are looming and Maud's annoyed that distracted Mildred isn't taking revision seriously. Miss Cackle goes to the cottage in the woods to learn Agatha has escaped. Ethel is desperate to find out the secret, so she does an impersonation spell to transform into Maud, hoping Mildred will open up to her. Mildred and Enid work out Ethel's plan and tell 'Maud' that the big secret is that Mildred is Miss Cackle's niece. Miss Cackle is annoyed and grounds the two of them. Mildred thinks Miss Cackle isn't herself and worries Agatha had returned from the cottage so she flies to Agatha's cottage in the woods. She meets Agatha and Gullet at the cottage and they try to take her powers, but she escapes. Ethel finds the birth scroll just as Miss Gullet and Agatha arrive at the castle. Esmerelda unwittingly invites them in, thinking Agatha is Miss Cackle, and gives up her powers - only to learn she's given them to the wrong sister. Agatha announces to the school that she is in charge. When Mildred finally arrives back at the castle, she's greeted by Maud and Miss Hardbroom who expels her.
